title: Superconducting Knot Solitons in Weinberg-Salam Model
abstract: We demonstrate the existence of stable knot solitons in the standard electroweak theory whose topological quantum number $\pi_3(S^3)$ is fixed by the Higgs doublet. The electroweak knots are made of the helical hypermagnetic flux tube which has a non-trivial dressing of the Higgs field, and carry a net supercurrent made of W-boson. We estimate the mass of the lightest knot to be around 15 TeV, and propose that the knots could be an ideal candidate of superconducting cosmic string.
